Other responsibilities that you will have:
   

  

* Develop engaging event visuals (booth designs, banners, collateral) for tradeshows, and user conferences.
* Transform webinar and video content into compelling multimedia assets for further marketing and sales enablement.
* Develop creative assets for content marketing, including white papers, brochures and presentations, with a clear B2B focus.
* Leverage AI tools and prompts to increase efficiency while maintaining creative excellence and brand consistency.
* Collaborate with the CMO and marketing team to iterate concepts and deliver quickly at startup speed.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in graphic design, visual communication, or related field.
* Minimum 2–4 years’ hands-on experience designing and producing assets for B2B SaaS or technology-led marketing.
* Portfolio demonstrating professional work on real B2B projects (not including retail, agency, or DTC-only work).
* Complete proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop), Canva, video editing software (Premiere Pro, After Effects), and collaboration platforms like Figma.
* Deep understanding of design principles (typography, colour, layout, digital usability) for business-driven audiences.
* Demonstrated proficiency using AI design tools and techniques.
* Self-sufficient professional with a strong ability to work independently and take full ownership of responsibilities.
* Excellent professional communication in English; with Swedish or Romanian a plus.


**What You Get**
* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.


**Our values at Xensam**
**Rebellious**
 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
   

  

**Humane**
 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmony**
 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.
   

  

**Please note!** 
 References and relevant portfolio required. Only those with proven, self-sufficient B2B design experience will be invited to interview.
   

  

 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered Software Asset Management technology. Designed to provide SAM Managers and IT Leaders with valuable data, our platform offers a wealth of features to simplify SAM workloads with built-in automation and advanced functionality. We prioritize ease of use and industry-leading security for both On-premise and Cloud software, putting organizations in total control of their hybrid IT environments.

title: UX/UI Designer to TRATON Financial Services
description:
Senior UX designer proficient in UI design
   

  

 Shape the Future of Financial Services
   

  

 Are you passionate about creating seamless digital experiences that make a real difference? Do you want to be part of a dynamic, growing team at the heart of innovation in the financial sector? TRATON Financial Services is looking for a driven and creative UX/UI Designer to join our journey!
   

  

**About Us**
 TRATON Financial Services is a young and ambitious organization, working across all brands within the TRATON Group - Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. We develop products and services for both internal users and end customers, driving digital transformation in the mobility and financial sectors.
   

  

 As our first dedicated UX/UI Designer, you will play a key role in defining design practices and ensuring our solutions are not only functional but delightful to use. You’ll collaborate closely with our Service Design Lead, internal stakeholders, and cross-functional teams across brands and markets.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Lead UX initiatives from research and concept to design and delivery, ensuring adherence to brand design systems.
* Conduct user research, usability testing, and measurement to continuously improve our products and services.
* Create user journeys that break down complexity and give a holistic view of services.
* Design intuitive, visually engaging interfaces and interaction flows that enhance user experience and drives adoption.
* Collaborate closely with developers to hand over designs, provide documentation, and ensure accurate implementation of user interfaces.
* Streamline design workflows and establish ways of working that scale across the organization.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and enable synergies between brands and markets.


**What We Offer**
* The chance to build new products and services used globally by multiple brands.
* A collaborative, international environment with a design community that spans across TRATON brands (Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International)
* A chance to define UX/UI practices in a growing organization.
* A supportive team culture where your ideas and expertise are valued.
* Flexible work arrangements with main office in Södertälje and co-working space in Stockholm


**What We’re Looking For**
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Design, Human Behavior, Interaction Design, or equivalent.
* Experience: 3-7 years of proven experience in UX and UI design, working with multiple user-centered digital products.
* Industry background: Experience in finance, insurance, banking, or mobility is a plus, but not required.
* High proficiency in design tools such as Figma and experience of working with design systems, ensuring consistency and scalability across digital products.
* Languages: Strong English skills required (our primary working language). Other languages are an advantage.
* Location: Able to work from our Södertälje office 2 days per week.


**Who You Are**
* Self-driven and proactive, but thrive in collaborative settings and build relationships across teams.
* Solution-oriented, focused on creating real value and impact for users and the business.
* Confident communicator, able to advocate for UX in a complex, IT-driven environment.
* Positive and resilient, delivering end-to-end; from insight to release.
* Curious and excited about new tech/AI, and how to use it to enhance design.
* A true ambassador for UX and human-centered design.


**TRATON Financial Services Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TFS supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible working hours, and the opportunity to lease a company car. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and residents in Stockholm have direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses, which you as an employee at TRATON Financial Services also have access to.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates and portfolio. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-10-02. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check is required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Johan Kjörning, Digital Officer, johan.kjorning@tratonfs.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
**This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Financial Services**
**#TFS**

title: Experienced E-commerce Designer
description:
As an Experienced E-commerce Designer at Grebban, you will be highly hands-on in producing, designing, and elevating flagship commerce experiences where brand storytelling, creativity, and conversion come together. With your experience, you will not only deliver outstanding design craft but also contribute with knowledge, methods, and best practices that raise the overall quality. In addition, you’ll act as a trusted e-commerce consultant for clients, providing strategic guidance and innovation that help generate customer value and business impact.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Producing and delivering high-quality e-commerce experiences that balance brand, usability, and conversion
* Acting as an e-commerce consultant for clients, guiding them on strategy, best practices, and innovation to deliver customer value and business impact
* Remaining deeply hands-on in design and production while contributing with insights and best practices from your experience
* Collaborating with clients, designers, developers, and strategists to deliver cohesive solutions
* Fostering a culture of learning and experimentation by sharing knowledge in day-to-day work
* Exploring AI, emerging technologies, and design tools to push boundaries
* Staying ahead of trends in UX/UI, brand, and digital commerce innovation


******What you bring******
* Strong professional experience and a portfolio of impactful e-commerce projects
* Deep understanding of how a brand translates into digital experiences
* Hands-on design, craft and ability to deliver consistent quality work
* Experience introducing design processes or methodologies
* Proficiency in Figma, AI-assisted workflows, and headless CMS/e-commerce platforms
* Great communication skills in both Swedish and English
* A collaborative, communicative, and inspiring approach


**************Why join Grebban?**************
* Work with leading brands across Europe and beyond on exciting, high-impact projects that drive customer value and business growth
* A highly creative, fast-paced, and collaborative team that values innovation and excellence
* Opportunities for career growth within e-commerce expertise in a rapidly evolving industry
* A culture of knowledge-sharing, where your ideas and insights are valued and encouraged
* Possibility to travel for workshops, client meetings, and industry events across Europe
* Competitive benefits, including pension plans, wellness allowances, and remote work flexibility
* A work environment fueled by curiosity, ambition, and passion for design & commerce


**Ready to join?**
 Send us your application with your CV and portfolio showcasing your best e-commerce/digital design projects.

title: Visual Designer with HMI focus
Digital Content Manager/UX Writer
description:
Är du nyfiken på att arbeta för ett kundägt bolag som sätter människor och samhälle i fokus och satsar långsiktigt på medarbetare, kunder och teknik?
   

  

 Hos Skandia blir du en del av vår pågående transformationsresa och kulturförflyttning, där du får stora möjligheter att påverka såväl vårt digitala uttryck som hur vi kommunicerar med våra kunder genom hela deras resa hos oss. Vi söker nu en strategisk sinnad och självgående UX Writer / Digital Content Manager som vill vara med och göra verklig skillnad – både i användarens upplevelse och i vår digitala affär. Rollen är operativ med fokus på att skapa och justera innehåll, men kräver också ett strategiskt öga för helheten.
   

  

**Att jobba som UX Writer / Digital Content Manager**
 Som UX Writer på Skandia arbetar du i gränslandet mellan design, kommunikation och affär. Du ansvarar för att skapa tydligt, tillgängligt och konverterande innehåll som förbättrar användarupplevelsen i varje steg av kundresan – från att väcka intresse, till att vägleda genom val och on-boarding, till att inspirera till vidare engagemang.
   

  

 I praktiken innebär det att du utvecklar och optimerar kundresor, digitala flöden, gränssnitt och copy / microcopy för våra spar- och pensionsprodukter. Du bidrar till att innehållet hänger ihop, är lätt att förstå och hjälper användaren att fatta trygga beslut. I vissa delar av kundresan – särskilt det som sker före och efter kärnflödet – driver du arbetet mer självständigt. Samtidigt är du alltid en del av ett nära och tvärfunktionellt samarbete, där du arbetar tillsammans med UX-designers, konverteringsexperter, CRM-specialister, analytiker och utvecklare.
   

  

 Du kommer också att ingå i våra utvecklingsteam där du bidrar operativt till utvecklingen av våra digitala funktioner – exempelvis hur man tecknar en kapitalförsäkring eller startar ett månadssparande – och ser till att gränssnitt och innehåll håller en hög, enhetlig kvalitet. Rollen kombinerar det strategiska och det operativa på ett sätt som ger stort utrymme för eget initiativ, nytänkande och ansvar.
   

  

 Du blir en del av Skandias centrala enhet för Customer Experience Management (CXM) och tillhöra ett av teamen som består av ca 16 personer där kompetenser som UX-design, konverteringsoptimering, CRM, analys och affärsutveckling samlas under ett gemensamt mål: att skapa bästa möjliga kundupplevelse och stärka vår digitala affär. Teamet arbetar mot hela organisationen och du växlar mellan större strategiska initiativ, specifika utvecklingsprojekt och löpande optimering av våra kanaler.
   

  

 Hos oss präglas kulturen av transparens, engagemang och ett stort kundfokus – men också av omtanke och ett varmt samarbetsklimat. Du kommer att arbeta med kollegor som brinner för sitt hantverk, och där vi lär och utvecklas tillsammans.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av UX writing, content design eller digitalt innehållsarbete med fokus på användarupplevelse. Du har god förståelse för hur digitala kundresor fungerar och kan identifiera var och hur innehåll gör störst skillnad – både för användaren och för affären. Vi tror att du är van vid att arbeta hypotesdrivet, att testa, justera och lära längs vägen. Du har både en strategisk höjd och en operativ leveransförmåga, och du trivs i en roll där du får driva ditt arbete framåt men samtidigt jobba nära andra.
   

  

 Som Person Är Du Självgående, Ansvarstagande Och Har Ett Öga För Detaljer. Du Är Lyhörd Och Empatisk, Både i Hur Du Förstår Användare Och i Hur Du Samarbetar Med Kollegor. Samtidigt Är Du Trygg i Din Kompetens Och Kan Presentera Och Argumentera För Dina Lösningar På Ett Övertygande Sätt. Du Är Prestigelös Och Nyfiken, Tycker Om Att Samarbeta Och Ser Värdet i Olika Perspektiv. Vi Tror Att Du Är En Modig Och Nytänkande Person Som Vågar Ifrågasätta Invanda Sätt Att Kommunicera Och Ständigt Söker Förbättring. Du Har Lätt För Att Samarbeta, Är Bekväm Med Att Fatta Egna Beslut Och Trivs i En Dynamisk Miljö Med Många Kontaktytor. Med Din Förståelse För Både Användarens Perspektiv Och Affärens Behov Drivs Du Av Att Hitta Det Enkla i Det Komplexa. Har Du Dessutom Erfarenhet Från Finansiella Tjänster, Sparande Eller Pension Ser Vi Det Som En Fördel, Liksom Om Du Har Arbetat Nära Utvecklingsteam Och Är Van Vid Agila Arbetssätt. Vi Tror Att Du Har
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom exempelvis medieteknik, digital kommunikation, marknadsföring eller liknande
* några års erfarenhet (3–5) från en liknande roll där du arbetat med innehåll, konvertering och digitala gränssnitt
* språkkonstnär, förmåga att skriva utifrån givna tonalitetsramar samt goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
* erfarenhet inom bank, finans och eller försäkring


**Vad händer nu**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast den 5/10. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Johan Jilborn på johan.jilborn@skandia.se
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Jennie Åkerlund på jennie.akerlund@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Placeringsort Stockholm, tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om Försäljning**
 Försäljnings uppdrag är att med hög kvalitet nå Skandias tillväxtmål gällande premievolymer genom försäljning och kundvård till nya och befintliga kunder.
   

  

 Vårt uppdrag är också att utveckla och säkerställa en konkurrenskraftig kundupplevelse i Skandias samtliga distributionskanaler och på så vis bidra till att upprätthålla den höga graden av nöjda kunder.

title: Senior UX Designer with HMI focus
Product Lead
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The Role - Product Lead**
 We are looking for a Product Lead to join one of our live game teams here at MAG. In this role, you’ll help nurture the game’s vision, set inspiring goals, and guide the team toward creating experiences our players truly love.
   

  

 Teamwork is at the heart of everything we do at MAG. As Product Lead, you’ll support your teammates by bringing clarity, helping to prioritize tasks, and encouraging collaboration so that together you can find the best solutions. Your curiosity, analytical skills, and care for our players will give you a clear, big-picture view of the game, helping the team make thoughtful and impactful decisions.
   

  

 You’ll also be the bridge between your team and the rest of the studio by sharing insights, celebrating progress, and making sure everyone’s aligned. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys being at the center of the action, thrives on collaboration, and loves the idea of keeping a much-loved live game fresh, fun, and rewarding for our players.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**
**Communicating vision and goals**
* Shape and share an inspiring vision for the game, making sure goals reflect both player needs and business objectives.
* Keep the team and stakeholders aligned and moving in the same direction.


**Planning and guiding the roadmap**
* Build and maintain a clear roadmap with the team, translating vision into achievable plans.
* Help prioritize through stand-ups, retros, and planning sessions, keeping focus on what matters most.
* Keep the backlog organized so the team can deliver smoothly.


**Driving progress and supporting delivery**
* Track progress against goals, ensuring milestones and live game improvements stay on course.
* Make thoughtful decisions to keep updates on schedule—finding the right balance between quality and timely delivery, so polishing doesn’t outweigh progress.
* Spot challenges early, solve problems quickly, and make sure the team has what they need to succeed.
* Encourage continuous improvements in how the team collaborates and delivers.


**Connecting the dots across the studio**
* Act as the bridge between your team and the wider studio, sharing updates and celebrating wins.
* Work closely with teams such as Marketing, UA, Backend, BI, and Management to align efforts, manage dependencies, and keep everyone moving forward together.


**Championing teamwork and team health**
* Foster a supportive, collaborative team culture where ideas and learning are encouraged.
* While 1:1s sit with the Head of Production, you’ll play a key role in day-to-day care and support making sure that the team is happy and working well together.


**Skills and Experience:**
* Experience in the games industry, with live games involving regular updates, new features, and ongoing improvements.
* A proactive and resourceful mindset, with the ability to prioritize effectively and adapt when challenges arise.
* Background in roles such as Producer, Game Designer, Product Owner, or Product Manager, with experience guiding teams and supporting collaboration.
* Comfortable shaping roadmaps, setting inspiring goals, and maintaining a clear game vision.
* Skilled in project management tools (we use Click-Up, but Jira or similar is welcome).
* Strong relationship-builder who enjoys working closely with teams like BI, Marketing, and Design.
* Curious and analytical, able to combine insights from multiple sources to guide decisions.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in small, close-knit environments.
* A genuine passion for games, especially mobile.


**Bonus Skills**
* Experience with in-game economies in F2P games.
* An eye for spotting opportunities and analyzing the overall “health” of a live game.


**Perks and Benefits:**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
   

  

 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
   

  

 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.
   

  

 MAG Interactive was founded in Stockholm in 2010.

title: Visual and Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Visual and Motion Designer**
 Type: permanent
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
   

  

**Portfolio Is Required**
**About the role:**
 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.
   

  

 You'll infuse fresh ideas, spark consumer interest through compelling creativity, and adhere to brand guidelines, managing projects within time and budget constraints. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you'll be a key player in driving design excellence and innovation.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Concept, idea development and visual design.
* Graphic design development including artwork, mock-ups, presentations, motion design/graphics.
* Social Media asset production.
* Monitor industry trends and research developments in branding and marketing.
* Produce designs/ideas to the client's brief and exacting standards from start to completion.
* Direct, oversee and execute production of content and concepts for digital platforms.
* Ensure all content is highest quality and relevant for multiple markets.
* Direct development of post imagery and copy, including guiding team members.
* Work proactively to push brands toward new creative expressions.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients.


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Motion Design and Animation:
+ Strong skills in 2D motion design and animation.
+ Keen eye for timing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
+ Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere.
+ Ability to storyboard animation concepts.
+ Experience creating engaging motion graphics for various platforms.

* Video Editing:
+ Proficient in editing video content for multiple platforms.
+ Skill in ensuring narrative flow and brand consistency.
+ Up-to-date knowledge of current editing trends, techniques, and emerging tools.
+ Experience in post-production and FX.
+ Ability to adapt content for different digital formats and channels.

* Design:
+ Solid foundation in graphic design, including typography, layout, and composition.
+ Ability to support and interpret art direction across motion and static assets.
+ Comfortable contributing to visual concept development.
+ Strong collaboration skills with senior creatives.
+ Experience creating cohesive design systems across multiple touchpoints.

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
* Strong typography, layout and technical skills with excellent attention to detail
* An understanding how to work across online banners (static and animated), social media posts (primarily Instagram and Facebook), web design, UI design, HTML email and storytelling
* An understanding of responsive design across all digital platforms
* An understanding of UX and latest Social and Digital technology trends
* Motion and video skills using After Effects, Premiere and Storyboarding Animation concepts
* Working on print-based collateral with great knowledge of branding
* The ability to talk through your ideas confidently with the team and clients
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and a keen interest in emerging technologies such as AI enhance project deliveries.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks and beverages sectors preferred.
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 Req ID: 13239
   

  

 Our values shape everything we do:
   

  

 Be
 **Ambitious** 
 to succeed
   

  

 Be
 **Imaginative** 
 to push the boundaries of what’s possible
   

  

 Be
 **Inspirational** 
 to do groundbreaking work
   

  

 Be
 **always learning and listening** 
 to understand
   

  

 Be
 **Results-focused** 
 to exceed expectations
   

  

 Be
 **actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist** 
 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,* 
*a part of the Brandtech Group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*
*OLIVER has set ambitious environmental goals around sustainability, with science-based emissions reduction targets. Collectively, we work towards our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.*

title: E-commerce Project Manager
description:
**Do you thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment, have a passion for e-commerce, and want to play a key part in a fast-growing company with global ambitions?**
 As an E-commerce Project Manager at Grebban, you will be an essential figure in our client projects, ensuring successful delivery from initiation to completion. Acting as a bridge between our development and design teams and our clients, you drive projects forward with a strong focus on client expectations and needs. You take full ownership of project planning, execution, and follow-up, ensuring that every delivery meets—and ideally exceeds—client expectations.
   

  

 In a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, your structured approach and decisive actions will be crucial. You are a technically savvy, detail-oriented leader who can navigate every phase of a project with confidence, inspiring your team and the client to work toward shared goals.
   

  

 We value hard work, passion, and dedication above raw talent, viewing our people as our greatest resource. Your ability to create structure and achieve results will be key to both our success and fulfilling our vision: always exceeding our client's expectations.
   

  

**To be successful in this role, we believe you have:**
* Strong technical understanding, preferably with experience in e-commerce, digital design and/or technical development.
* Exceptional relationship-building skills, enabling you to work effectively with clients and internal teams in a global setting with diverse cultures, locations, and languages.
* High self-motivation and a service-oriented mindset, with the ability to lead technically complex projects.
* Proven leadership experience, managing fast-paced, technically advanced projects.
* Experience in development, technology, and system architecture (programming skills not required).
* Expertise in agile project management, particularly methodologies like Scrum.
* Familiarity with tools such as Asana, Trello, Google Workspace, Figma.
* A strong understanding of client relationships, acting as the primary point of contact for customers.
* Fluency in English (written and spoken), is essential for our international ambitions.
* Extensive experience leading teams, from small groups to larger project teams, is advantageous.
* A flexible approach to travel, with opportunities to visit clients across the Nordics and Europe as we expand.


**Example responsibilities:**
* Managing budgets and client expectations to ensure projects stay on track and deliver exceptional results.
* Overseeing and continuously improving clients' e-commerce solutions with a focus on quality and efficiency.
* Maintaining high client satisfaction through building and nurturing long-term client relationships.
* Leading e-commerce projects from concept to completion, keeping a detailed and holistic perspective.
* Developing fast-growing e-commerce platforms with scalability and quality as priorities.
* Managing projects that combine customer experience (design/UX) and technical development to deliver optimal user experiences.
* Participating in business development and optimizing project processes to maximize client satisfaction and efficiency.
* Working with CMS- and e-commerce platforms/systems, ensuring seamless and user-friendly content management.


**What we offer:**
* The opportunity to work on exciting projects with leading brands.
* Competitive benefits, including biannual salary reviews, a generous pension plan, wellness allowances, remote work flexibility, and state-of-the-art equipment.
* A fast-paced, fun, and supportive team with a collaborative culture.
* A flexible, modern working structure with autonomous teams and predictable sprint cycles.
* Continuous skill development opportunities through internal task forces, external conferences, and more.
* Plenty of opportunities to grow, whether you want to advance as a specialist or develop into a leadership role.
* The chance to work with brands that inspire you.


**About us:**
 Grebban develops brands and designs e-commerce experiences for committed and ambitious clients around the world. We are one of the most sought-after agencies in Europe, working primarily with brands seeking long-term partnerships. We have a very high success rate in creating significant business value for our clients.
   

  

 As e-commerce specialists, we guide our clients to get the best outcomes in their most critical sales channels. Our services include brand design, growth strategies, UX and digital design, system architecture, and building state-of-the-art e-commerce solutions. We are headless experts, primarily working with platforms like Centra, Norce, and Shopify Plus. Some of Grebban’s clients include J.Lindeberg, Björn Borg, Djerf Avenue, iDeal of Sweden, Kari-Traa, Hestra, NN07, Filippa K, and Sandqvist.
   

  

**Interested?**
 We’re always eager to meet Project Managers who want to be part of our team. If you’re passionate about e-commerce and have a client-first approach, send us your application! Let’s explore how you can contribute to our exciting projects at Grebban.

title: Senior Visual Designer with HMI focus
Senior Product Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 Yubico is looking for a Senior Product Manager to expand and maintain products within the Hardware products. You will drive and deliver the success of your products/product areas of focus and expand the use of our technology to new and innovative areas that capture the market demand. Be part of a fast-paced, high-energy team, working with customers that represent some of the most sophisticated technology buyers on the planet.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Responsible for the production systems that are used to program, customize, and output YubiKey's and YubiHSM's at scale
* Provide data-driven insights on the specific products being managed, including sales and financial performance, year-over-year trends, pipeline, etc
* Manage the full life-cycle of a product from inception to end of life including: conception, market and requirements gathering, customer validation, creation of high-quality requirements document, management of engineering, marketing preparation, release and end-of-life processes
* Meet with customers to understand market demand and outcomes for new products
* Partner with all teams in the company, demonstrating ownership for the product area of focus, to develop and launch new products that meet company objectives and achieve a successful product
* Take responsibility for the success of all aspects of the products, or product areas, in focus
* Gain deep market and technical knowledge of the market focused on specific competitors and their offerings and strategies
* Understand the core value of both the products being managed, but also all products and services at Yubico
* Articulate the core value of the product and inspire other team members to be excited about selling and supporting the products
* Maintain the ability to have deep technical conversations about Yubico technology, but also the underlying technology platforms, etc
* Collaborate with product marketing to create or enhance product collateral, marketing messaging, blogs, and related activities
* Represent Yubico in meetings with key customers and partners to help drive our business



  




**Basic Requirements:** 
* Five (5) years’ experience in Product Management
* One or more of the following: Eight (8) years’ experience in IT or technology, Eight (8) years’ experience in security
* Experience in managing stakeholders
* Excellent written and oral business communication skills
* Ability to collaborate across geographically dispersed functions






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Product Owner
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**In Search Of a Product Owner who’s hungry to shape what’s next in video commerce with a world-class team by your side** 




  





 At Bambuser, we’re transforming how the world shops online by bringing video commerce to life for some of the world’s most loved brands.
 



 It doesn't matter if you’re early in your career or already have plenty of experience. What matters is hunger. Energy. The drive to spot opportunities, rally people, and ship products that make a difference.
 



 We’re a small team with big ambitions and capabilities. You’ll be right at the center – working with senior devs, designers, and customer-facing teams to uncover opportunities, test ideas, and launch products that create real impact for our users and our business.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Own projects from idea through launch and follow the impact
* Talk to customers and our internal teams to spot opportunities worth building
* Test ideas quickly (no need to design yourself, but you know how to validate fast)
* Write clear, simple specs and work closely with your dev team
* Help bring focus and prioritization in a fast-changing environment
* Share results openly – what worked, what didn’t, and what you learned.
* Drive measurable impact: adoption, engagement, revenue.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We believe you will thrive if you…
 


* Have experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager, Associate PM, or similar role (or you’ve built your own side projects and have something to show for it)
* Know how to build products in cross-functional teams with engineers, designers, CSMs, and sales
* You don’t just make decisions, you make them stick. You explain the why, rally the team, and turn tough calls into shared momentum.
* Can turn user insights into ideas worth testing
* Bring just enough structure to help us scale without slowing us down
* Think in terms of user value and business outcomes, and how to balance them
* Communicate clearly with senior developers and understand technical trade-off
* Are comfortable using tools like Figma, GA, Miro/Notion (or similar)



  





**Bonus If You…** 



* Have been an engineer yourself or studied engineering
* Have worked with e-commerce, video, or SaaS tools
* Have side projects, hackathon experience, or things you’ve shipped just for fun
* Are excited about AI, automation, or rapid prototyping tools
* Have startup or scale-up experience



  





**Who You’ll Work With** 




 You’ll be part of a small, tight-knit product team led by our VP of Product & Innovation. Your closest collaborators will be our engineers (R&D), our designer, and stakeholders from Customer Success and Sales.
 



  





**Why Join Bambuser?** 




 We combine the impact and pace of a scale-up with the creativity of a startup. We’re not just another SaaS company. We’re building the future of video commerce. At Bambuser, you’ll have the freedom, trust, and tech firepower to move fast and build things that matter.
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 Forget buzzwords and laundry lists. Tell us what excites you about this role! Show us how you've driven real impact in previous product work. Applications are reviewed continuously.
 



  





 At this time, we’re only considering candidates located in the Stockholm area who already have the right to work in Sweden (no visa sponsorship required)

title: E-commerce Frontend Developer
description:
**Hi there! 👋**
 At Grebban, we’re on a mission to create exceptional e-commerce experiences, and we’d love for you to be part of it. We’re a close-knit team that works alongside our clients to truly understand their needs, using our e-commerce expertise to help them reach their goals. If you’re passionate about creating great user experiences, love problem-solving, and are eager to learn and grow –keep reading!
   

  

 We’re looking for a front-end developer with a few years of experience (bonus points if it’s in e-commerce), who has a talent in React.js and wants to work on innovative, client-focused solutions. You’ll be part of a collaborative, supportive team, working closely with designers, backend developers, strategists, and—most importantly—our clients to bring amazing ideas to life.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 In this role, you’ll work directly with our clients and internal teams to create, adapt, and implement solutions that solve real business challenges. You’ll be at the heart of understanding our clients’ needs, making smart technical decisions, and building scalable, future-proof solutions that help their businesses grow.
   

  

 You’ll analyze business processes, create custom solutions, and guide clients through every step of the development process. Collaboration is key, so you’ll also work closely with other teams to ensure everything integrates smoothly and meets high technical standards.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A few years of experience in a similar role (bonus if you’ve worked in e-commerce or with headless solutions like Next.js or Gatsby!).
* Strong skills in core web technologies—HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React.js—with a good understanding of TypeScript.
* Someone who loves building high-performance, intuitive user interfaces and solving complex problems.
* A team player who enjoys collaborating with others and getting the best results together.
* Someone who is familiar with tools like styled-components, Redux, GraphQL, or any other modern web dev technologies!


**We believe you are**
* Curious and always looking for ways to learn and grow in your career.
* Someone who thrives in a team environment and loves sharing knowledge with others.
* Client-focused and passionate about creating solutions that make a real difference
* to the businesses and brands you work with.
* Comfortable communicating in both English and Swedish, whether it’s with your team or directly with clients
* Experienced working with version control systems.


**Why you’ll love it here**
 We’re proud of our open, welcoming culture where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are valued. We believe that the best ideas come from diversity, and we’re always excited to hear what you bring to the table. We’re a team that values collaboration and making an impact, both for our clients and for each other.
   

  

**Here’s what else you can expect:**
* Close collaboration with clients to create innovative solutions that matter.
* A supportive, fun team that loves to share knowledge and grow together.
* Flexible work options—whether that’s working from home or collaborating in person.
* Opportunities to continue learning, growing, and developing in a role that supports your career journey.
* To make friends for life and have the most exciting years of your career!


**Sound like a good fit?**
 If this sounds like something you’d love to be part of and contribute to, we want to hear from you. Apply today!

title: Staff Engineer - Audio
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role & You**
 You’re relentlessly driven to understand how things work, the kind of person who dives deep when something breaks and won’t stop until you understand it and it’s fixed. You have applied this drive to understand the endlessly complex world of audio. A medium where edge-cases are the norm and any non standard processing requires a deep understanding..
   

  

 You thrive in this complexity. You’ve built audio pipelines end-to-end and felt the real-world pain of making them work at scale, from managing flaky devices to handling buffering, mixing, streaming, and transcription. Where others see chaos, you see a system to be understood, stabilized, and made reliable.
   

  

 At Tandem Health, you’ll lead the effort to build and scale our massive audio pipelines that power real-time healthcare conversations. From ensuring the right microphone is active to delivering accurate transcripts, you’ll make sure our audio systems are seamless, stable, and ready to scale across the continent.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both our technical architecture and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by solving deeply technical problems in one of the most complex and rewarding mediums, we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

* Lead the design, development, and scaling of our audio pipelines, enabling real-time streaming of healthcare conversations with high reliability.
* Build systems that span the full chain, from device input and buffering to mixing, streaming, and transcription, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of audio data.
* Ensure stability, performance, and scalability of our audio infrastructure as we scale to support healthcare organizations across Europe.
* Collaborate across the stack, from frontend UX for audio-native products to backend processing systems and databases that handle high-volume streams.
* Drive best practices in audio engineering, setting technical direction and standards while mentoring engineers working on audio-related systems.
* Continuously improve our audio technology, iterating on tooling, monitoring, and evaluation to ensure high quality and reliability in production.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A proven track record of building and deploying large-scale audio pipelines in production environments.
* Deep experience working across the full stack, from frontend applications to backend services and databases, with a focus on audio-heavy systems.
* Hands-on experience building audio-native products, where audio is central to the user experience.
* A deep curiosity for complex systems and a relentless drive to make them work - you go beyond surface fixes to understand what’s really happening under the hood.
* A strong ability to design systems that remain stable, performant, and reliable at scale, even under real-world constraints and device variability.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams to build robust, high-quality systems.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience with speech-to-text and transcription systems in production environments.
* Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.
* Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.
* Experience with frontend development in JS and React.
* Experience with Windows development in C#.


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers
* Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team
* First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Senior Game Designer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)** 




  





 At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
 



  





**The Role – Senior Game Designer** 




  





 We’re looking for a Senior Game Designer to join the QuizDuel team. We are seeking someone who enjoys
 **crafting fun, engaging experiences** 
 , bringing fresh ideas to life, and helping shape the future of one of our most
 **popular live titles** 
 .
 



  





 This role is perfect for someone who loves collaborating with others, exploring creative solutions, and making thoughtful design decisions by
 **combining creativity, data and player insights** 
 . You’ll work closely with a talented, supportive, and cross-functional team where
 **your ideas will make a real impact** 
 .
 



  





 Check out QuizDuel here: https://www.maginteractive.com/games/quizduel/
 



  





 Although this role is to work with the QuizDuel team, you may work in other teams here at MAG in the future.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 




  




* Design and deliver
 **innovative features, mechanics, and content** 
 that delight and engage our players.
* Manage the
 **full design process** 
 , from concept and prototyping to implementation and iteration.
* Develop a deep understanding of
 **QuizDuel’s modes, events, and systems** 
 … and yes, you’ll play it a lot!
* Collaborate closely with the product lead, developers, artists, and the data analyst in the team to bring your designs to life.
* Use
 **player insights and analytics** 
 to refine features and enhance the player experience. Don't worry there’s no need to crunch numbers, but you’ll understand what they mean.
* Keep up to date with
 **F2P market trends and competitor games** 
 to inspire creative innovation.
* **Deconstruct successful F2P game systems** 
 to inform and strengthen your design strategies.
* Share your ideas clearly and confidently, ensuring everyone understands the why behind your ideas.
* Regularly
 **seek feedback and collaborate** 
 with wider teams at MAG to ensure you are making use of the knowledge we have internally.



  





**Your Skills & Experience** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in
 **game design** 
 , ideally in
 **F2P casual mobile games** 
 .
* Experience working on
 **live games with high DAU** 
 , balancing player enjoyment, innovation, and business goals.
* Strong understanding of
 **F2P fundamentals** 
 such as; engagement loops, progression, monetization, and balancing.
* Comfortable interpreting
 **key metrics** 
 (e.g. retention, ARPDAU, conversion, churn) to identify opportunities for improving features.
* Familiarity with
 **analytics dashboards** 
 and the ability to apply insights effectively.
* A proven track record of
 **designing and iterating** 
 on
 **features that enhance player experience.**
* Excellent
 **communication skills** 
 so you are able to share your vision clearly and listen openly to feedback.
* Curious, and driven, you will be given a lot of trust to seek out new ideas and make an impact on a key game here at MAG.
* Fluent in
 **English** 
 (written and verbal).



  





**Nice to Have** 




  




* Unity experience to prototype and test ideas independently.
* Knowledge of level design, balancing, and progression systems.



  





**Perks and Benefits** 




  




* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly after works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives
* Free weekly beginner Swedish lessons (if you want to learn the language)!



  





**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!** 




**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.** 




  





**About MAG** 




  





 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
 



  





 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
 



 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.

title: Android-utvecklare
description:
**För En Hållbar Framtid Tillsammans**
 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
   

  

**Bli en del av Coop – Tillsammans gör vi mat-Sverige hållbart!**
**Om Tjänsten**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara dagligvaruhandel? Som Androidutvecklare på Coop Sverige får du möjlighet att driva innovation och bidra till vårt viktiga arbete för en mer hållbar framtid. Vi söker dig som är en Senior Androidutvecklare och som vill vara en del av avdelningen DigIT Betalningar på Coop Sverige.
   

  

**Som Senior Androidutvecklare Kommer Du Att Arbeta Med Att**
* Ansvara för utvecklingen av två centrala appar Scan & Pay (B2C) och Fakturatjänst (B2B), viktiga självbetalningslösningar som används i såväl bemannad som obemannade butiker.
* Vidareutveckla och förbättra befintliga funktioner för att skapa en ännu bättre kundupplevelse och öka antalet aktiva användare.
* Arbeta i ett mindre team med stort ägandeskap, där du ansvarar för hela kedjan från utveckling till test och release.
* Delta i sprintplaneringar, demos och retros enligt Scrum och samarbeta nära produktägare, backend-utvecklare och UX-specialister från andra delar av Coop.
* 
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet i din egen kod då teamet inte har en dedikerad testare.
* Bidra till att forma framtidens digitala butikserbjudande hos en av Sveriges största dagligvaruaktörer.


 Du blir en del av ett mindre team där produktägaren ansvarar för prioriteringen av arbetet, samtidigt som du har många kontaktytor i resten av organisationen. I vardagen samarbetar du nära andra utvecklingsteam på Coop. Vi arbetar enligt Scrum och ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt.
   

  

***Vem är du?***
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet av Anroidutveckling, som har en stark känsla för kvalitet och användarupplevelse samt kan tillhandahålla tydliga tids- och kostnadsuppskattningar. Du är självgående men samtidigt en prestigelös teamspelare som trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Som person är du analytisk och problemlösande med en nyfikenhet på nya teknologier och arbetssätt. Du har ett starkt intresse för att skapa enkla, tillgängliga och användarvänliga lösningar alltid med konsumenten i fokus. Du har en lojalitet och ansvarskänsla som gör att du tar ägarskap för ditt arbete.
   

  

**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av Androidutveckling, med mycket goda kunskaper i Kotlin och/eller Java.
* Erfarenhet av Jetpack Compose och XML-baserad UI-utveckling samt vana att integrera externa SDK:er.
* God förståelse för REST-API:er och JSON, samt erfarenhet av Androids designprinciper och kodstandarder.
* Vbana att arbeta i Android Studio och med felsökningsverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av RxJava.
* Erfarenhet av Firebase/Firestone & Firebase Cloud Functions.
* Erfarenhet av Goole Pay.
* Vana att arbeta i agila team enligt Scrum (erfarenhet av SAFe är meriterande).
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift samt bekväm med att prata engelska.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av designsystem, tillgänglighet och testningsramverk.
* Bakgrund inom retail, dagligvaruhandel, e-handel eller payments.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Unit testing.
* Kunskap om regelverk och direktiv såsom PCI DSS, GDPR eller Tillgänglighetsdirektivet.
* Intresse för användarupplevelse och tillgänglighet samt en vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad om nya teknologier, verktyg och metoder.


**Vårt Erbjudande Till Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur. Hos oss på Coop får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Så Ansöker Du**
 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast den
 **2025-10-19** 
 , då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Tobias Sakket på e-postadress:
 **Tobias.Sakket@coop.se**

title: Staff Engineer - Authentication
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role & You**
 You’re a deeply curious person and that curiosity has led you deep into the world of authentication and identity. You care profoundly about how people prove who they are on the internet, how systems decide who gets access to what, and how we can make those decisions seamlessly and securely.
   

  

 Over the years, you’ve worked with a wide variety of authentication methods, identity frameworks, and security standards. You’ve seen the tradeoffs of different approaches firsthand and learned how to design systems that balance security, usability, and scalability. At your previous companies, people came to you when they wanted to understand how authentication
 *actually* 
 works under the hood.
   

  

 At Tandem, you’ll lead the effort to build secure, robust, and user-friendly authentication systems that power the next generation of healthcare products. You’ll define the technical direction, set standards, and design core identity infrastructure - enabling safe, seamless access for clinicians and patients across all European countries.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building authentication systems that people can trust and doing it at the scale and safety level healthcare demands we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

* Lead the design and development of our authentication and identity systems - from foundational protocols to user-facing access flows that are critical to clinician and patient trust.
* Define and implement robust authorization frameworks, ensuring users only access the data and functionality they are entitled to, while keeping the experience seamless.
* Evaluate and integrate industry standards and authentication technologies, understanding the tradeoffs to select the right approach for each use case.
* Build systems that scale securely, enabling safe and reliable identity management as our products grow to support healthcare organizations and their preferred Identity Providers across Europe..
* Serve as the go-to expert on authentication, helping others understand how identity systems work under the hood and driving best practices across the company.
* Set the technical direction for our identity and security efforts, mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of security, reliability, and technical excellence.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A proven track record of designing and implementing secure authentication and authorization systems in production environments.
* Deep experience with industry standards and identity frameworks (e.g. OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, or similar) and a clear understanding of their tradeoffs.
* The ability to build systems that remain secure, performant, and reliable at scale, including rolling out authentication stacks to large user bases.
* A passion for digital identity and a deep curiosity for how systems work under the hood, you want to understand, not just use, the technology.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate closely with engineering, product, and security stakeholders across the organization.
* A bias toward ownership, proactivity, and collaboration, you take responsibility for outcomes and raise the bar for everyone around you.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Strong experience building SSO integrations across diverse providers, and a clear vision for how to unify identity across multiple countries and healthcare partners.
* Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.
* Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers
* Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team
* First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 3 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you’ll work on improving and developing our platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. Your contributions will directly influence how we attract and convert visitors into loyal users of our commercial streaming platform in our Engineering organization. You’ll contribute to building and refining our backend services, as well as supporting our product teams with a seamless user experience by aligning the backend and tooling.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a key role in driving this transformation. With a cutting-edge serverless architecture built on Node.js, Rust and AWS, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team that’s small but mighty, with members in Stockholm and Barcelona. Our mission? To deliver platform solutions that align with both technical and product visions, focusing on the commercial structure of our streaming service.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Developing services using technologies such as Node.js or Rust
* Strong grasp of object-oriented programming principles
* Familiarity with test-driven or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) and related frameworks
* Experience developing services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* A track record of contributing to refactoring initiatives in a dynamic organization
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience building state-less, high-transactional end-user products
* Advanced knowledge of AWS services (S3, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc)


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Tjänstespecialist
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.



För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.


**Om rollen**
