* Identify and drive opportunities to shift testing earlier in the development cycle and increase automation, especially in areas currently relying on manual efforts.
* Help debug and interpret build failures, read stack traces, and proactively work with developers to resolve issues, especially around failed test pipelines.
* Ensure QA-related metrics (e.g., test coverage, pipeline pass rate) are visualized on dashboards and available for team insights and follow-up.
* Participate in and contribute to the QA Competence Forum and help spread knowledge, tools, and good practices across teams.
* Provide strategic input to improve long-term testing and quality assurance capabilities Provide hands-on support with the AEM platform, including train and support for local content teams in localization, publishing, best practices, by utilizing its capabilities (components, page types, etc.) to the fullest.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has solid understanding of test processes, pipelines (e.g., GitLab CI), and modern QA tools and frameworks.
* Has experience with at least some of the following tools is a plus: Playwright, PACT, JUnit, Gherkin, Robot Framework, Zephyr, Jira, Confluence.
* Has proven experience in software testing, preferably in mixed environments involving embedded systems (for example RS485 and Zigbee HW) and cloud based systems (AWS).
* Has basic understanding of programming and ability to read logs, stack traces, and CI/CD outputs. Direct coding experience is a bonus.
* Is fluent in English and Swedish.


 Familiarity with networked systems, radio communication, and embedded software integration is beneficial, as well as ISTQB certification (or former ISEB).
   

  

 We are looking for someone with excellent communication skills and a team player mindset, who is solution-oriented, adaptable, and curious – someone who enjoys working across disciplines and solving practical problems. We need a person that has strong ability to collaborate and communicate with both local and remote developers and testers, and has a sense of ownership and accountability, with a drive to ensure robust, automated, and scalable testing. If you’re able to build trust and foster collaboration between geographically distributed teams, we may be looking for you!
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* Hybrid model of working.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Flexible working hours.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


  

  

**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here!
   

  

  

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha at Daria.Skucha@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Handläggare till enheten för utveckling av brottsbekämpning, Noa
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift? Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 Nationella operativa avdelningen (Noa) ansvarar för att upprätthålla en strategisk nationell lägesbild över brottsligheten i Sverige och leda arbetet med förmågeutveckling av brottsbekämpningen. Vidare ansvarar Noa för nationell och internationell samordning av brottsbekämpande verksamhet samt högspecialiserad och unik polisverksamhet som kompletterar polisregionerna vid behov. Finanspolisen, nationellt it-brottscentrum och det myndighetsgemensamma arbetet mot den organiserade brottsligheten finns vid avdelningen.
   

  

 Enheten för utveckling av brottsbekämpning (UB) är en av enheterna vid Noa och ansvarar för att samordna inrikta och prioritera den strategiska systempåverkande förmågeutvecklingen samt verkar för att Polismyndigheten över tid har en relevant brottsbekämpande förmåga. Detta genom att löpande analysera och förstå brottsutvecklingen och kontinuerligt anpassa förmågan. Utvecklingsarbetet sker utifrån operativa problem och i nära samarbete med övriga Polismyndigheten.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra UB kansli och arbeta gränsöverskridande inom hela enheten och avdelningen för att på bästa sätt lösa tilldelade arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I din roll som handläggare har du särskilt ansvar för samordning av dataskydd. Din uppgift är att säkerställa att personuppgifter och information behandlas på ett korrekt och lagligt sätt, samt att informera och ge råd inom dessa frågor.
   

  

 I rollen som handläggare med ansvar för samordning av dataskyddsfrågor ingår bland annat att:
   

  

* löpande hantera och samordna dessa frågor
* säkerställa att framtagna rutiner för kontroll och uppföljning följs
* initiera och delta i utvecklingsarbete
* bistå UB ledning och andra företrädare inom verksamheten med vägledning, information och beslut inom dessa områden


 Som medarbetare på enhetens kansli kommer du att även att utgöra ett stöd för enhetens ledning i andra frågor, exempelvis genom att bistå vid samordning och hantering av ärenden, viss projektledning eller annat där din kompetens förväntas bidra till en effektiv brottsbekämpning.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* För funktionen relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande utbildning, exempelvis jurist-eller statsvetarexamen, alternativt annan utbildning eller yrkeserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdigt och relevant.
* Erfarenhet av dataskydd
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av förändringsarbete
* Erfarenhet av arbete med projektledning
* Erfarenhet av arbete som handläggare inom statlig myndighet
* Erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska då arbetsuppgifterna ställer höga krav på korrekt dokumentation och kommunikation. Du är initiativrik och flexibel, vilket gör att du snabbt kan anpassa dig till förändrade arbetsförhållanden. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du kunna identifiera och självständigt hantera arbetsuppgifter inom dina tilldelade ansvarsområden. Rollen innebär många kontaktytor, vilket kräver god förmåga att samarbeta och bygga relationer med andra.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef:
   

  

 Jenny Gustafsson tfn: 076-762 07 03, jenny.gustafsson@polisen.se
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult: thomas.blomgren@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Sofia Ask, Polisförbundet,
   

  

 tfn 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO-S nås via Polisens växel 114 14
   

  

 ST, Jessica Stålenkrans, tfn 010-563 32 66
   

  

 Karna Tillheden, SEKO Polisen,
   

  

 tfn 073-249 04 22
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare / Polisassistent
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Handläggare
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara nedan urvalsfrågor. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen.
 **Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.**
 Besvara följande urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan.
   

  

* Har du för funktionen relevant akademisk examen/utbildning såsom jurist, statsvetare alternativt annan utbildning eller erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant? (om ja, beskriv utbildning,)
* Har du erfarenhet av dataskydd och informationssäkerhet? (om ja, beskriv din erfarenhet kortfattat)
* Har du god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska? (Om ja, beskriv kortfattat)
* Har du svenskt medborgarskap? Ja/Nej
* Har du erfarenhet av förändringsarbete? (Om ja, beskriv kortfattat)
* Har du erfarenhet av arbete med projektledning? (Om ja, beskriv kortfattat)
* Har du erfarenhet av arbete som handläggare inom statlig myndighet? (Om ja, beskriv vilken myndighet, antal år)


 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och svar på urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.noa@polisen.se
 **senast 26 september/2025.** 
 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A562.635/2025 i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.

title: Senior Project Manager
Sales Manager B2B at Wolt
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 1000 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Sales Manager** 
 at Wolt, you’ll be at the forefront of our growth and we want you to be our deal-closer towards restaurants, retailers, and other local businesses. You’ll identify potential partners, pitch the value of Wolt, and work closely with merchants to onboard them successfully onto our platform.
   

  

 With solid product knowledge, you will clearly communicate how Wolt can strengthen businesses and provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs. In addition, you will work closely with other internal departments to ensure a smooth transition from sales to implementation and support.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a driven and experienced sales professional who is eager to take their career to the next level through hands-on sales success. At Wolt, ambition and impact matter most – and we believe your personality, track record, and ability to build strong relationships will define your success.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who has already demonstrated strong results in B2B sales and is excited to keep pushing for growth: building pipelines, closing deals, and exceeding targets.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Prospect, negotiate, and close partnerships with key merchants across multiple verticals (restaurants, retail, grocery.
* Drive and lead complex sales cycles with senior decision-makers
* Shape sales strategies and identify new growth opportunities in the market
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure smooth partner onboarding and long-term success
* Mentor and support junior sales colleagues by sharing best practices and expertise


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 2–4 years of B2B sales experience, ideally in restaurant, retail, or related industries
* Proven track record in closing complex deals and achieving ambitious sales targets
* Excellent command of Swedish and English. Fluency in another language is a strong plus
* Willingness to travel extensively across Sweden, including overnight stays (up to 75% of working time)
* A driver’s license is not required, but considered a strong plus


 We will place great emphasis on your personal qualities – particularly your ability to combine drive and ambition with collaboration and leadership.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Wolt, you get the best of both worlds: the fast pace and opportunity of a scale-up combined with the stability and backing of a well-established company.
   

  

* A chance to shape the future of Wolt’s sales strategy in Sweden.
* A role where your ideas can make a direct impact.
* A competitive salary package and benefits.
* Ongoing coaching, clear goals, and opportunities to grow into broader leadership roles.


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Customer Technology Advisor - Security
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a Customer Technology Advisor and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the practice-specific domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a Customer Technology Advisor, you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in a practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus area(s) including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Juniora Analysts till Enterprise Technology & Performance (Stockholm) - Aug 2026
description:
Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 450 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå ambitiösa mål genom områdes- och branschexpertis, global räckvidd och allianser med de största tech-leverantörerna. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

 Inom Enterprise Technology & Performance stödjer du Deloittes klienter med att få ut det största möjliga värde av sina IT-investeringar genom att fungera som stöd vid transformationer.
   

  

  





**Emerging ERP Solutions & SAP:**
  

 Inom teamen Emerging ERP Solutions och SAP stödjer du Deloittes kunder med implementationsprojekt där du hjälper dem att optimera och automatisera processer inom ekonomi och varuflöden med hjälp av världsledande ERP-lösningar som SAP, Oracle NetSuite och Infor M3. Deloitte leder hela resan och erbjuder våra klienter en helhetslösning, från förstudier och genomförandet av transformationen till den tekniska implementeringen. Varje ERP-implementering fokuserar på att stödja affärsstrategier genom processförbättringar och teknisk innovation.
 *Vi anställer till vårt kontor i Stockholm, med start i augusti 2026.*




**Technology, Strategy & Transformation:**
  

 Inom teamet Technology Strategy & Transformation fokuserar du på att hjälpa Deloittes kunder utveckla IT-relaterade strategier och transformation som löser komplexa utmaningar. Du arbetar nära kundernas CIO:er och IT-chefer med den tekniska agendan vilket bl.a. inkluderar tekniska strategier, IT-styrning, operativa modeller, IT-arkitektur, IT sourcing (bl.a. upphandlingsrådgivning), IT-relaterade kostnadsbesparingar, samt implementering och optimering av tekniska lösningar.
 *Vi anställer till vårt kontor i Stockholm, med start i augusti 2026.*



**Kvalifikationer**

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

  




* Är nyexaminerad med en kandidat- och/ eller magister/masterexamen inom relevanta områden, såsom IT, systemvetenskap, data, ekonomi och/ eller industriell ekonomi.


* För Emerging ERP Solutions och SAP ser vi gärna att du har en utbildningsbakgrund som kombinerar ekonomi, finans eller Supply Chain med IT och affärssystem.


* Har goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Har ett genuint intresse för IT-driven affärsutveckling


 Meriterande:
   

  

  

* Goda akademiska meriter, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna


* Erfarenhet av affärssystem, processdesign och konsultarbete relaterat till digital transformation


* Bekväm i en internationell kontext, då många av våra klienter är internationella och samarbete med kollegor i andra länder är en vanlig del av arbetet.


 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, ambitiös och brinner för att lära dig mer om våra kunders utmaningar och behov samt hur IT kan skapa ökat affärsvärde. Du är en ödmjuk och lyhörd lagspelare som trivs med projektarbete och nära samarbete med interna så väl som externa kollegor.
   

  

  


*Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.*



**Ytterligare information**

**Vi erbjuder**
  

 Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor som är experter inom sina områden. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär och kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.
   

  

  





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.
   

  

  





**Ansökan**
  

 Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:
   

  

  




* CV


* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.


 I det första steget laddar du upp ditt CV. I nästa steg laddar du upp dina universitetsbetyg (över hittills avklarade kurser) samt svarar på frågor som är kopplade till rollen, inklusive en motivering till varför du sökt denna roll. Observera att både CV samt fullständiga betyg behöver laddas upp för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Vi tillämpar löpande urval, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vid inskickad ansökan ska du få ett bekräftelsemejl från oss. Får du inte detta mejl råder vi dig att skicka in din ansökan på nytt. Om du söker flera tjänster hos oss ber vi dig att i dina ansökningar tydliggöra vilken roll du är mest intresserad av.
   

  

  


 Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/. För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.
   

  

  





**Frågor**
  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Johanna Aspegårdh, jaspegardh@deloitte.se
   

  

  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Director, IT Strategy Consulting, SAP
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**About The Role**
 Gartner Consulting is experiencing accelerating demand for independent, strategic advice in the SAP domain. We are seeking seasoned SAP professionals to join our Nordic & European team, delivering end-to-end SAP strategy and transformation services that drive measurable client value and impact. You will work across both public sector and commercial industries, partnering with leading organizations to guide their SAP transformation journeys—especially the transition to S/4HANA.
   

  

**Why Join Gartner Consulting?**
* Influence the SAP transformation journeys of leading organizations across the Nordic and EMEA regions.
* Work alongside a team of recognized experts in a collaborative, growth-focused environment.
* Access to Gartner’s industry-leading research, methodologies, and professional development resources.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.


 As a member of our expert team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing SAP-enabled business transformations, moving beyond strategy development to deliver tangible value realization. You will contribute to the ongoing development and maturity of Gartner’s Enterprise Applications consulting practice, leveraging Gartner’s research and best practices to enhance client outcomes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Advise C-suite and senior stakeholders on SAP strategy, transformation roadmaps, and S/4HANA migration, aligning technology initiatives with business objectives.
* Drive and guide SAP transformation engagements, from initial strategic assessment and business case development through implementation, change management, and value realization.
* Develop and refine methodologies, tools, and approaches to accelerate client impact and ensure delivery excellence.
* Identify and pursue opportunities to expand client relationships and grow the SAP consulting practice across the Nordic and EMEA regions.
* Deliver quality assurance on key project deliverables, ensuring alignment with Gartner’s high standards and client expectations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation, share thought leadership, and contribute to go-to-market strategies.


**Ideal Candidate Profile**
* Extensive experience in client-facing consulting roles, with a proven track record of leading SAP transformation programs for large, complex organizations.
* Deep understanding of SAP S/4HANA and core SAP modules (Finance, HR, Supply Chain), including target state definition, business case development, and migration planning.
* Demonstrated ability to baseline existing SAP/ERP environments and architect transition strategies to S/4HANA-enabled future states.
* Exceptional executive communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience presenting to CxO-level audiences.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and deliver compelling analysis and presentations that drive client decision-making.
* Experience in developing and maturing SAP service offerings, including methodologies, deliverables, and go-to-market plans.
* Strong business development acumen, with a history of identifying and realizing SAP/ERP expansion opportunities.
* Commitment to continuous learning and staying abreast of SAP trends, best practices, and industry developments.
* Required: Eligible for Finnish security clearance.
* Required: Fluent Swedish


**Who you are:**
* Comfortable selling to, influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives
* Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
* A consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges
* Proven track record in achieving / exceeding revenue targets
* Ability to travel to client sites as necessary


 Associates are expected to travel to client sites and meetings as required by business needs or specific engagement requirements, ensuring we deliver exceptional service where it matters most. While we value the flexibility of our hybrid work environment, in-person collaboration with clients and teams is an essential part of how we work and grow together.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:83178
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: IT GRC-specialist
company_industry: Insurance, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Financial Services
description:
Är du en driven doer som jobbar med IT GRC? Är du bra på att omsätta teori till lösningar? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en IT GRC-specialist (Governance, Risk och Compliance) för att förvalta och utveckla IT-enhetens GRC-arbete på Folksam. Det pågår spännande förbättringsinitiativ, inom bland annat interna kontroller och kopplat till Dora-förordningen (för digital operativ motståndskraft), där denna roll kommer göra skillnad.
 



  





 Tjänsten kan anpassas i senioritet beroende på kunskap och erfarenhet av sökande.
 



  





**Det här gör du som IT GRC-specialist på Folksam** 




 Du är med och leder IT-enhetens arbete med riskhantering, internkontroll och regelefterlevnad. Ett arbete som drivs systematiskt och utifrån gemensamma processer. Arbetet ska löpande reducera risker och hjälpa IT enheten att styras proaktivt och riskbaserat.
 



  





 Du är en del av ett team av experter på riskhantering och regelefterlevnad och tillsammans driver vi förändring, samtidigt som vi uppfyller våra åtaganden både internt och externt.
 



  





 Du ingår i avdelningen IT Resilience, en avdelning som jobbar proaktivt för att säkerställa att Folksams IT-miljöer är motståndskraftiga genom kontinuitet, regelefterlevnad och riskhantering.
 



 Du rapporterar till avdelningens chef och samverkar med ledare och specialister inom både IT och övrig verksamhet.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att:
 


* Driva GRC-arbetet på IT i linje med strategier/ målbilder och etablerade arbetssätt.
* Ansvara för arbetet med interna kontroller inom IT-enhetens delprocesser, både löpande arbete och förändringsarbete.
* Stödja och utföra löpande arbetsuppgifter såsom att följa upp;
* att interna kontroller utförs och underlag sparas, samt att brister åtgärdas
* att resultat av granskningar och överenskomna åtgärder införs inom avtalad tid, samt samordna kontakt med revisorer och kontrollfunktioner
* att riskförteckning/riskmodell hålls uppdaterad och att åtgärder implementeras löpande för att reducera operativ risk.
* Driva förbättringsarbete och delta i initiativ inom GRC, genom att se över nuvarande arbetssätt och löpande implementera förbättringar (stora som små).
* Samarbeta med GRC-specialister inom IT-organisationen och inom Folksam gruppen samt med centrala funktioner för risk, regelefterlevnad och internkontroll.
* Förklara och utbilda inom GRC området för att bygga en medvetenhet kring vikten av riskhantering, regelefterlevnad, intern kontroll (idag och i framtiden).



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk utbildning, en bakgrund inom GRC och gärna med erfarenhet från kontrollrevisioner (exempelvis ISAE, SOC2) och interna kontroller.
 



  





 Du tar självständigt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och tycker om struktur samt ordning och reda. Du är en doer som får saker att hända och implementeras.
 



  





 Rollen innefattar samarbeten med olika delar av organisationen vilket ställer krav på att du arbetar bra med andra människor och lyckas skapa engagemang och sprida kunskap. Vidare kommunicerar du på ett tydligt sätt och säkerställer att budskap går fram.
 



  





 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet från och kunskap om flera av dessa områden:
 


* Erfarenhet av interna kontroller och processer.
* Erfarenhet av GRC-områdena riskhantering, regelefterlevnad, revision och governance.
* Kunskaper i standarder och ramverk inom IT-verksamhet och -säkerhet, t.ex. ITIL, ISO 27000/22301-serien, Cobit m.fl.
* Erfarenhet av bolag med reglerad verksamhet, t.ex. bank, finans, försäkring, betalning eller liknande.
* Kunskap om hur lagar, förordningar och föreskrifter ställer krav på verksamheten (t.ex. DORA, FRL, GDPR, och FFFS) samt förmåga att läsa och tolka regelverk.
* Utbildningar eller certifieringar inom GRC (t.ex. GRCP, CRISC, CISM eller CISA).
* Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar och van att förklara komplexa frågor på ett enkelt sätt.
* Erfarenhet av att bereda underlag och presentera till beslutande interna intressenter.
* Erfarenhet av analys och utredningsarbete för att identifiera brister och föreslå lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning.
* Erfarenhet/kunskap om SAFe och agila arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet/kunskap om verktyg såsom JIRA, PowerBI och Ardoq.



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 12 oktober 2025.
 



 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef Linn Thuvesson, 070-831 62 95.
 



 Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson 073-423 59 12 och Handels Mikael Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Key Account Director - Europe and Middle East
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 Your mission when joining the team at Einride will be to drive top-line expansion within our most strategic and high-revenue accounts
   

  

 You will
   

  

 Be the growth catalyst across business units working hand-in-hand with commercial, product, operations, and solutions teams to deliver impact, innovation, and enduring partnerships. Your focus will be to turn major accounts into long-term growth engines through hands-on customer work, strategic planning, stakeholder orchestration, and value creation.
   

  

* Craft growth plans: Develop live growth plans based on Einride’s future capabilities and market developments +12 months, identifying and enabling 'first-in-history' initiatives.
* Build strategic relationships: Proactively build and deepen key stakeholder relationships and mapping to enable closure of short-term deals and realization of midlong-term growth.
* Identify short-term opportunities: Orchestrate opportunity overviews across Einride’s business units to ensure each customer account’s full potential is addressed short term.
* Translate business requirements: Use growth plans and customer interactions to surface clear business requirements and channel them into actionable product feedback.
* Track account performance: Monitor and manage account-level performance, value creation, and progress toward shared goals.


**We Expect You To**
 Have a strong background in strategic growth and a passion for decarbonizing freight. The ideal candidate will have multiple years of experience in account management, strategic growth, or complex B2B solution selling, with a strong preference for the transportation, logistics, supply chain, or adjacent tech sectors.
   

  

* Customer Intimacy: Proven track record of growing enterprise accounts with multi-product offerings, preferably both hardware and software.
* Industry Expertise: A combination of a deep personal network within transportation and logistics decision-maker circles and strong technical acumen in SaaS, fleet analytics, or supply chain optimization tools.
* Innovation Mindset: A history of launching and scaling creative, first-of-its-kind initiatives with customers.
* Collaborative Leadership: Ability to align cross-functional internal teams and lead through influence across product, engineering, operations, and go-to-market teams.
* Languages: Fluency in both English and German is required; knowledge of other major European languages is a plus.


 This is a full-time position based anywhere in Sweden or Germany. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Två verksamhetsutvecklare
description:
Brinner du för att omsätta komplexa behov till smarta lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Som verksamhetsutvecklare i team BeTa får du driva innovation, utveckla tjänster och skapa värde för både kunder och handläggare – från kartläggning av behov till realisering.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som verksamhetsutvecklare blir du en del av verksamhetsutvecklingsteamet BeTa, som ansvarar för både förvaltning och utveckling av processer, arbetssätt och tjänster inom bostads- och inkomststöd. Teamet arbetar med att initiera nya lösningar samt skapa förbättrade tjänster för våra handläggare och kunder.
   

  

 I rollen stärker du produktionsområdets förmåga att analysera och kartlägga verksamhetens behov, samt utveckla och förvalta våra nya kärnsystem. Med ett agilt arbetssätt leder och deltar du i analys-, innovations- och designarbete där lagkrav, verksamhetsbehov, kundinsikter och IT-möjligheter omsätts till konkreta förbättringar och nytta.
   

  

 I teamet arbetar du med hela kedjan – från behovsidentifiering till färdig lösning – och har en central roll i utvecklingen av den operativa värdeströmmen Ekonomiskt stöd till pensionärer. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med agila IT-team och andra intressenter och omfattar produkt- och tjänsteutveckling, process- och metodutveckling, kravanalys samt omvärldsbevakning.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* analysera behov inför framtagande, utveckling och förvaltning av kärnsystem.
* utveckla koncept för både analoga och digitala tjänster, rutiner, processer och regelförändringar.
* omsätta lagändringar till konkreta utvecklingsinsatser med kundens och verksamhetens behov i fokus.


 Du ingår i ett verksamhetsutvecklingsteam som idag består av 6 st teammedlemmar, 1 st Product Owner (PO) samt 1 st Business Owner (BO).
   

  

**Din profil**
 Det är inte enbart dina erfarenheter som är viktiga för oss, utan framför allt din förmåga att skapa värde. Vi lägger därför stor vikt vid din personliga kompetens. Vi söker dig med starkt inre driv som tar initiativ, arbetar självständigt men också bidrar aktivt till teamets mål. Med ansvarskänsla och resultatfokus levererar du uppgifter med hög kvalitet.
   

  

 Du är nyfiken på IT system och processer, och drivs av att omvandla dem till nytta för kunder och verksamhet. Du får energi av att införa förbättringar, testa nya arbetssätt och tänka långsiktigt med helhetsperspektiv.
   

  

 Du är lyhörd och konstruktiv som kommunicerar väl och löser problem tillsammans med andra. Din analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att förstå komplexa samband och fatta välgrundade beslut.
   

  

 Vi söker också dig som har:
   

  

* relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* mångårig och aktuell erfarenhet av handläggning eller verksamhetsutveckling från arbete inom offentlig sektor eller har kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* mycket god förmåga att kommunicera och formulera dig i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* mycket god produktkunskap kring bostadstillägg och äldreförsörjningsstöd såväl regelverk som hanterar förmånerna eller likvärdig förmånskunskap i en myndighetskontext
* aktuell arbetserfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling
* arbetat med digitalisering och automatisering


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsterna är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 I den här tjänsten kan du utgå från något av Pensionsmyndighetens kontor i Stockholm, Luleå, Söderhamn, Gävle, Karlstad, Växjö, Visby eller Halmstad.
   

  

 Vi kommer att använda arbetspsykologiska tester som en del i urvalet.
   

  

 Digitala intervjuer är planerade att hållas vecka 44.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare.
   

  

 FILM: Vårt jobb berör alla (youtube.com)
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Ospecificerad arbetsort | Län: Ospecificerad arbetsort | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-114 | Kontakt: Malin Valeus Westerlund , Dzemal Hadzic , | Facklig företrädare: Linda Sageland, Saco-s 010-4543903, Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, | Publicerat: 2025-09-10 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-08

title: Sales Manager
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Are you hungry for a new challenge and have sales skills sharp as a pizza slicer? We are looking for our next Sales Manager who loves to break new records while feeling extra proud representing an amazing brand like foodora. Are you a sales enthusiast with a year (or more) of deal-closing prowess, who thrives on the adrenaline of sealing the perfect deal? At foodora we believe in creating your own journey and it starts with you sending in an application today!**
**Your mission**
* Your main task is to contact restaurants via physical sales meetings, phone calls and e-mail with the goal to make them join our platform.
* Be a part of a high performing team where you will be working independently as well as close to your supporting colleagues.
* Visiting restaurants all over Sweden and taking part in other sales related projects at foodora.
* Together with your manager engage in your sales development while making sure to have a sustainable work-life balance.


 We are looking for a true foodorian who enjoys working in a fast paced environment. To thrive in this role we believe that you are
 **result oriented** 
 and keep your eyes on the prize, we love to measure both success and find opportunities for improvement, which we hope that you also do! If you are
 **fearless** 
 and have a
 **can do-attitude** 
 you will come far in this role! Since you will be in contact with many different restaurants we believe that you are an
 **outgoing** 
 person who can create amazing first impressions as well as achieve your sales results.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* You have some experience working with sales and are eager to learn more about sales and develop your skills! We believe that the right mindset + willing to learn are the best ingredients.
* You communicate fluently verbally and in writing in both Swedish and English
* Strong advantage if you have a driver’s license


**Additional Information**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and insipring courses within Sana Labs.
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Ecom & CRM Manager
description:
**Job Purpose**
 As an E-commerce & CRM Manager, you are responsible for maintaining and optimizing the website to ensure a seamless and engaging shopping experience for our customers. This includes everything from merchandising the site and enriching product information to uploading content and ensuring the website is always up to date, on-brand, and user-friendly. Your work plays a key role in supporting online sales and delivering a smooth digital journey that reflects CHIMI’s identity and values.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will be responsible for managing and updating product information on the website, including descriptions, images, and metadata such as titles and descriptions. You will merchandise the site to support product launches, campaigns, and seasonal changes, as well as upload and publish content such as homepage banners, landing pages, and campaign assets. To ensure a seamless customer experience, you will monitor the website daily to confirm that all pages are functioning correctly and that content is always up to date.
   

  

 You will support the execution of sales campaigns, promotions, and product launches by coordinating with logistics and operations teams to ensure product availability and accurate delivery information. On the marketing side, you will create and send newsletters, promotional emails, and automated flows, segmenting customer data to enable targeted communication. You will also monitor email performance and help optimize campaigns for engagement and conversion.
   

  

 Additionally, you will be responsible for key e-commerce KPIs such as traffic, conversion rate, and average order value. You will report bugs or issues with the website and follow up with internal or external tech teams to secure timely fixes. Collaboration will be central to your role, as you will work closely with marketing, design, operations, and customer service to align website and CRM activities, while coordinating content and campaign timing across departments.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Degree in E-commerce or Marketing, Digital Communication.
* 2-3 years of experience in e-commerce.
* Hands-on experience with e-commerce platforms (Centra and Storyblok are a plus).
* Interest or some exposure to CRM systems (Klaviyo is a plus)
* Hands-on experience from working with and owning digital performance metrics (Traffic, conversion rate, average order value, open rate).
* Curious about how data can be used to improve customer experience and drive sales.
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).


**Key Competencies**
 You have a strong attention to detail, particularly when it comes to handling product information and content, ensuring accuracy and consistency at all times. With a structured and organized approach, you are comfortable managing multiple small tasks simultaneously without losing track of priorities. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you thrive as a team player who enjoys working closely with colleagues across marketing, design, tech, and other functions.
   

  

 You bring a proactive mindset and a willingness to learn by doing, always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes. Commercially driven and with a clear customer-first perspective, you balance business goals with delivering value to the end user. At the same time, you are curious about exploring new tools and approaches - such as leveraging AI - to work more effectively in everyday tasks and to find smarter solutions.
   

  

**Main KPIs**
* Ecom budget
* Conversion rate
* Average order value
* Bounce rate
* Add-to-cart rate
* Retention rate
* CRM share of business


**Personal Attributes**
* Eager to learn and grow in the e-commerce and CRM space.
* Calm under pressure and able to prioritize effectively.
* Innovative and forward-thinking, with a strong interest in fashion-tech.
* Positive, proactive, and solution-oriented.
* Comfortable asking questions and taking initiative


 This role is based at our Stockholm HQ and reports to our CEO.

title: Courier hourly
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Couriers.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Representing FedEx in front of our customers, courteously picking up and delivering their packages
* Driving vehicles in FedEx fleet on defined routes in various postcodes, making sure customers’ packages get to the right place, on time
* Making sure vehicles are always operated safely and legally
* Following all FedEx Health and Safety and other company policies and procedures


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Be a reliable team player
* Be energetic and enthusiastic
* Have a strong customer focus
* Have good communication skills
* Have an eye for detail to make sure paperwork is correct
* Holding a valid driving license for type of vehicle assigned is essential and held for 2+ years would be an advantage.
* Adaptability to external driving conditions and circumstances is required
* Commercial driving experience would be an advantage
* Basic geographical knowledge


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Account Executive - New Business Acquisition
company_industry: Events Services, Marketing Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Aurora Live by Management Events** 
 is the leading B2B growth partner for technology and management service providers, giving direct access to top decision-makers at the largest, most influential companies. Through our exclusive matchmaking services, we help commercial teams shorten sales cycles, accelerate sales flow, and build lasting customer relationships. Trusted by over 10,000 senior IT decision makers and 900 solution providers across 11 countries, we drive strategic conversations that deliver real business outcomes. we’ve become a key growth driver for many of the most innovative players in the space.
 



  





 To support our ambitious growth plans, we are seeking an experienced
 **Sales Manager** 
 to join our dynamic and rapidly growing B2B organization. In this role, you will
 **be responsible for building your own client base from scratch in the Swedish market** 
 —driving the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing. Once you win new business, you will
 **own and nurture those accounts long-term** 
 , ensuring they continue to see value and grow with us. You’ll benefit from an attractive commission structure that rewards both new business and client growth.
 



  





  





**Your mission:** 




  




* Proactively identify, qualify, and pursue potential clients to build your pipeline
* Drive outreach through phone, email, and LinkedIn to create new business opportunities
* Conduct in-depth needs assessments to uncover client pain points and tailor solutions
* Build trust and credibility by demonstrating expertise and delivering value
* Take full ownership of the accounts you win—managing and expanding them over time
* Drive customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional service
* Partner with cross-functional teams to achieve shared objectives and optimize performance
* Continuously expand your industry knowledge to stay ahead of trends and client needs



  





  





**What we’re looking for:** 




  




* A solid track record of success in B2B sales
* A proactive, self-driven mindset with a strong work ethic and a genuine ambition to grow in an international environment
* Experience thriving in a fast-paced, target-driven setting
* Strong ability to build rapport, earn trust, and nurture client relationships
* Excellent communication skills in
 **Swedish** 
 (both written and verbal), with professional fluency in English



  





  





**About Management Events:** 




  




* Comprehensive 4 weeks onboarding and ongoing support
* Great earning potentials with base salary, uncapped commission, and quarterly bonuses
* Earn up to 12 additional vacation days on top of the annual vacation days
* Well-being benefits such as gym and massage discounts
* Regular social events and team-building activities
* Be part of the culture, where we enjoy spending time together and work together towards our targets!
* We offer thorough training in our international ME Academy and continuous training and self-development opportunities during your employment.
* Join the international growth organization with plenty of opportunities! ME has been awarded several times as one of the Best Places to Work in Europe (by Great Place to Work Institute)



  





  





**Recruitment process:** 




  




* Screening video call with with recruitment
* First interview with hiring manager
* Second interview (including role-play) with team manager
* Reference check



  





  





 For more information, please contact Noora Soini, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at noora.soini@managementevents.com

title: Regional Performance Marketing Intern
description:
**We are now seeking a full-time Performance Marketing Intern from January 2026 for a minimum of 6 months to join our EMEA Marketing Team at BabyBjörn HQ in Stockholm.** 




  





 As a Performance Marketing Intern, you will gain hands-on experience in key aspects of performance-driven digital marketing-helping accelerate our brand's growth across paid social channels, affiliate networks, and SEM, while sharpening your analytical and creative skills.
 



  





 Reporting directly to the Performance Specialist and being a member of the EMEA marketing team, you will be immersed in campaign strategy, execution, analysis, and optimization. Additionally, you'll participate in cross-functional meetings, support other key marketing projects across media and trade marketing.
 



  





**What you will be doing in your role:** 



* Assist in managing, optimising, and expanding our affiliate marketing programs, identifying new partner opportunities, onboarding affiliates, and maintaining strong relationships with existing partners.
* Contribute to the planning, execution, and optimisation of paid social media campaigns (primarily META), including audience targeting, creative testing, budget allocation, and performance analysis.
* Support the management of SEM campaigns, including keyword selection, ad copy creation, performance monitoring, and reporting.
* Participate in ongoing A/B testing and experimentation across channels to identify growth drivers, improve conversion rates, and optimise ROAS.
* Assist in preparing detailed reports to track KPIs, share campaign insights, and present analyses for internal and external stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on marketing initiatives and participate in regional team meetings.



  





 You will also have the opportunity to support other key EMEA marketing areas throughout this 6 month period.
 



  





**What skills will help you be successful:** 



* You’re currently pursuing a degree in business or digital marketing
* Familiarity with marketing principles and an interest in customer acquisition and digital advertising
* Previous work experience in growth-related marketing or business development is preferred
* Must be a positive and outgoing person with an entrepreneurial mindset
* Strong team player with an interest in learning new things
* Fluent in English, with additional languages being a plus



  





 T
 **he internship MUST be part of your education/university program as it is unpaid.** 




  





 In your application, we want you to include:
 


* What are you studying, and what is the purpose of your internship?
* Whether the internship is connected to a school project?
* Why you want to intern with us?



  





 As EMEAl Performance Marketing Intern, you will be reporting to the EMEA Performance Specialist and you will be based at the BabyBjörn HQ in Stockholm (Sundbyberg), Sweden.
 



  





 We are accepting applications for this position until October 30th, 2025, but we will start interviewing applicants before that time.
 



  





 We look forward to reviewing your application!
 



  





*BabyBjörn AB is a Swedish, family-owned company that has around 200 employees within its Groups and develops, markets, and distributes children´s products, primarily for the age group 0-3 years. The company was founded in 1961, and since then more than 50 million children have been carried in our baby carriers. We have a turnover today of more than SEK 1 billion, and 95% of our sales are exports to more than fifty countries. As we exist for all types of families, no matter their structure, lifestyle, or identity, we strive for this to be reflected in our organization as well.* 




*More information is available at www.babybjorn.com* 




  





*Important information when submitting an application to BabyBjörn AB:* 




*By submitting an application, you consent to BabyBjörn AB storing and potentially using your personal data for recruitment purposes for a period of 24 months following the date on which the data was obtained. Your personal data will not be processed for any purpose other than that previously stated, and your data will not be transferred to a third party. For more information about where and for how long we process your personal data, as well as more information about your rights regarding erasure and data portability, please contact us at mydata@babybjorn.com.*

title: Senior mjukvarukonsult till försvarsindustrin
description:
**At Professional Galaxy AB,** 
 we help businesses leverage technology to simplify operations and drive growth. We deliver tailored, scalable IT solutions using Java, Python, Cloud platforms, and more. Our consultants specialize in IT and engineering roles, including Software Development, DevOps, Systems Engineering, Project Management, Cybersecurity, and Finance.
   

  

 With expertise in sourcing and contract management, we optimize supply chains, strengthen supplier relationships, and support strategic procurement. By combining technical skills with business insight, we enable clients to overcome today’s challenges and prepare for tomorrow’s opportunities.
   

  

**Professional Galaxy** 
 söker nu en erfaren mjukvarukonsult med bred teknisk kompetens till vår kund inom försvarsindustrin. Uppdraget är på plats i Järfälla och ger dig möjlighet att bidra i en verksamhet där avancerad systemutveckling och höga krav på säkerhet står i fokus.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Som konsult kommer du att arbeta med komplex mjukvaruutveckling i en miljö som ställer höga krav på robusthet, kvalitet och säkerhet. Rollen är starkt kompetensdriven och du förväntas bidra med expertkunskap inom flera programmeringsspråk samt god förståelse för verktyg och plattformar som används i utvecklingskedjan.
   

  

**Krav**
 Senior nivå: minst 8 års erfarenhet inom relevant mjukvaruutveckling
   

  

 Expertkunskap i Java, ADA, C++, C och Python
   

  

 Goda kunskaper i versionshantering (Git, CVS)
   

  

 Goda kunskaper i Linux och Jenkins
   

  

 Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
   

  

 Godkänd säkerhetsprövning krävs innan start.
   

  

**Offer due date:** 
 2025.09.29
   

  

**Duration:** 
 2025.11.03 - Open
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi hanterar ansökningar och tillsätter uppdrag löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta Ritu Sareen, ritu.sareen@progalaxy.se

title: Salesforce Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
**Salesforce Consultant - Award winning company** 




  





**Company:** 




  





 Recently recognised as one of Sweden's best places to work, my client is one of the Europe’s leading IT Consultancies. Offering an enviable portfolio of services which includes Consulting, Systems Integration and Implementation of Application Solutions their clients include some of the biggest companies in the world. Due in part to alliances with some of the fastest growing, most recognisable Software companies they continue to enjoy phenomenal growth.
 



  





 Following several new significant business wins, one of which ranks as one of the largest of it’s kind in the Nordics, they are looking for a number of Salesforce Consultants to join the fast-growing practice.
 



  





**Role:** 




  





 As a Salesforce Consultant you will be responsible for engagements such as the deployment, configuration and development of customised Salesforce solutions. You will also play an instrumental role in continuing the growth and firmly establishing the organisation as one of the leading Salesforce Partners in the region.
 



  





 The opportunities are largely based in Stockholm with visibility to customers when required.
 



  





  





**Required skills:** 



* Hands on experience of Salesforce with a track record leading and delivering technical projects.
* Either Consulting experience or strong experience in a Salesforce focussed role for a large/enterprise organisation.
* Relevant Salesforce certifications are advantageous.
* Fluent English and Swedish language skills are essential.



  





  





***Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.***

title: Learning & Development Project Manager
description:
Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. Dometic is on an exciting journey. We have set an ambitious vision and are on a mission to empower more people to connect with nature. We are now hiring a digitally savvy Learning & Development Project Manager to lead the global implementation and development of our digital learning environments – a key enabler of product knowledge and capability building across the organization.
   

  

**About The Position**
**As** 
**Learning & Development Project Manager** 
 at Dometic, you will play a central role in shaping how our teams learn, grow, and succeed.
