title: Senior Media Backend Engineer - Content Platform
description:
Join us to build products impacting over half a billion users globally, shaping their audio and video consumption one stream at a time. Your contributions will have significant impact at scale.
   

  

 Spotify's backend media transcoding teams are responsible for processing all audio, video, and image content on the platform. We handle diverse media files and are committed to delivering a high-quality user experience through our large-scale, high-performance cloud-based services.
   

  

 Our team fosters a collaborative and passionate environment where a deep interest in technical details like timestamps, codecs, and video quality is highly valued. We encourage in-depth exploration, critical thinking, and collaborative problem-solving. We offer a flexible hybrid work model and prioritize genuine work over performative actions. Here, what you create and how you create it are paramount.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, deploy, maintain, and support backend media processing and packaging services - with a sharp eye on performance, scalability, and maintainability.
* Work primarily with Rust, Python, and a bit of Java, leveraging C/C++ libraries - all running smoothly in Google Kubernetes Engine.
* Take operational ownership of your team’s services, including participating in an on-call rotation (because you care about what you build).
* Dive deep into media technologies and optimize video/audio processing
* Collaborate with a dedicated team of media tech enthusiasts who think reading a 200-page ISO specification is a good day.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Fluent in systems-level engineering (think highly-optimized, cross-platform C/C++ libraries).
* Experience in media formats, codecs (audio & video), containers - and you love knowing why they work the way they do.
* Worked with open Source tools like FFmpeg (and yes, we mean libav\*), Shaka Packager, and friends.
* Experienced in data structures, algorithms, CPUs, caches, RAM and how to leverage them to maximize performance.
* Has experience building high-throughput networking services that don’t flinch under load.
* You get a thrill from optimizing media delivery - whether that’s tweaking transcoding pipelines, improving playback start times, or debating progressive download vs adaptive HTTP streaming.
* You’re comfy in Linux environments and know your way around container-based infrastructure.
* You care about the craft of software engineering: continuous delivery, defensive programming, automated testing, and writing code your future self will thank you for.
* You’re curious, always keeping up with the latest in media codecs and high-performance backend trends.
* Bonus points if you’ve contributed to Open Source media projects, compiled your own FFmpeg, or can explain why pixels aren’t always square.
* You architect, design, develop, test, and maintain reliable, high-throughput backend services.


 Where You´ll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Machine Learning Engineer till Ictech Stockholm!
description:
**Ictech intar Stockholm!**
 Vi öppnar nu vårt nya kontor i Stockholm! Med lång erfarenhet i branschen och ett starkt nätverk i regionen bygger vi en stabil grund för fortsatt framgång. Ictech, grundat 2011 i Göteborg, är ett växande konsultbolag med 160 anställda över 5 olika orter, specialiserade på system- och mjukvaruutveckling. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga vårt nya kontor från grunden. Är du vår nästa stjärna?
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren Machine Learning Engineer med minst 10 års erfarenhet som vill skapa verklig impact med AI. Hos oss får du arbeta med stora datamängder, avancerade algoritmer och feature engineering, bygga skalbara ML-lösningar och robust datainfrastruktur, samt skriva välstrukturerad och återanvändbar kod. Du utvecklar gemensamma komponenter och ramverk, driftsätter modeller i produktion och samarbetar nära ingenjörer, data scientists och affärsstakeholders för att forma företagets interna AI-ekosystem. Här får du möjlighet att driva innovation, ta ansvar och se dina lösningar göra skillnad i praktiken.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har minst 10 års erfarenhet av maskininlärning och AI-teknologier (t.ex. TensorFlow, PyTorch)
* Har en kandidatexamen eller magisterexamen inom datavetenskap, teknik eller relaterat område – eller motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet
* Har minst 7 års professionell erfarenhet i relevanta roller som Machine Learning Engineer
* Är en praktiskt lagd person som älskar att koda och tycker om att tillämpa goda mjukvaruutvecklingsprinciper i maskininlärningsprojekt.
* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla mjukvaruprodukter som framgångsrikt tagits i produktion
* Har flera års erfarenhet av programmering i moderna språk, och särskilt gedigen bakgrund i Python-programmering (minst 3 år)
* Har stor erfarenhet av molnteknologier för maskininlärning, gärna Google Cloud och Vertex AI
* Har stark kompetens inom MLOps, inklusive att bygga ML-pipelines och driftsätta ML-applikationer i produktion
* Har god kunskap om ett brett spektrum av AI/ML-tekniker och erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika ramverk
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera stora volymer heterogen data (både batch och strömmande) samt god förståelse för datastrukturer, databaser och lagringsteknologier.
* Är van att arbeta agilt med god samarbetsförmåga i team, och förespråkar datadriven utveckling samt ansvarsfull och tillförlitlig experimentering.


**Varför Ictech?**
* Konsulter som trivs bra: 95% tycker att vi är en ideal arbetsgivare
* Flexibel lönemodell där du styr löneuttag, semester och val av uppdrag... Eller en fast lönemodell beroende på vad du föredrar!
* Låg personalomsättning (6%)
* Våra medarbetare har en snitterfarenhet på 14 år, med bred kompetens


 Som anställd på Ictech får du möjlighet att
 **utvecklas både tekniskt och professionellt** 
 genom uppdrag hos olika kunder inom flera branscher – ofta med stor flexibilitet. Vi tror på att våra konsulter gör störst nytta när de får använda sin expertis i uppdrag som verkligen passar dem, och vi ser till att
 **du har inflytande över vilka uppdrag du tar dig an** 
 .
   

  

**Vi värdesätter det personliga** 
 : för oss är rätt person på rätt uppdrag avgörande och vi har få anställda per chef för att säkerställa rätt stöd och tid. Det ger resultat,
 **100% skulle rekommendera oss för en vän** 
 och
 **97% känner sig uppskattade av sin chef** 
 .
 **Det är siffror vi är stolta över!**
 Vi erbjuder
 **kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling** 
 genom utbildningar och nya tekniska utmaningar, samtidigt som du är en del av en stark företagskultur där gemenskap, omtanke och arbetsglädje står i centrum.
   

  

 Hos oss har du också stor frihet att påverka din arbetssituation. Vi erbjuder
 **konkurrenskraftig lön** 
 och
 **riktigt generösa förmåner** 
 – och du kan själv välja mellan en flexibel eller traditionell lönemodell, beroende på vad som passar dig bäst.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra mer om dig.

title: Senior Frontend Developer till IT Customer and accounts
description:
**I rollen får du:** 




 • Skapa värde för våra produkter och kunder.
 



 • Jobba med fantastiska medarbetare i en lärande och utvecklande miljö.
 



 • Flexibelt arbete och balans i livet.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en frontend-utvecklare till IT customer and accounts. Teamet jobbar med centrala applikationer i ATG:s miljö inom områdena payment, responsible gambling och anti money laundry, så det är en fördel om du trivs med att jobba i komplexa och transaktionstunga miljöer. Gör du det så välkomnas du till ett team som har kul tillsammans och som tror på öppenhet och transparens i arbetet. Vi jobbar blandat på kontoret och hemifrån, men har daglig kontakt i teamet och samarbetar även tvärfunktionellt med andra team inom IT.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som söker har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet inom frontend-utveckling. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Det är viktigt att du är en teamspelare som har en god samarbetsförmåga. Du bör även ha en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska. Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av och intresse för backend-utveckling samt app-utveckling och eventuellt vill gå mot att bli fullstack-utvecklare på sikt. För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du känner till arbete med agila metoder och värdesätter teamarbete men även eget ansvar. Vidare ser vi att du gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om och är nyfiken på att lära dig nya tekniska lösningar.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av:
 



 • React
 



 • Typescript
 



 • Redux
 



 • Redux Saga
 



 • HTML
 



 • CSS
 



 • React Native
 



 • (GraphQL)
 



  





 Meriterande:
 



 • AWS
 



 • Microfrontend
 



 • Playwright
 



  





**"För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare”** 




 Jag är en engagerad ledare som drivs av att se människor och organisationer utvecklas. Jag litar på mina medarbetare fullt ut. De är experterna, och jag finns där för att stötta och skapa så bra förutsättningar som möjligt för att alla ska kunna göra ett bra jobb och trivas på arbetsplatsen. Jag har arbetat med IT sen början av 00-talet, men är själv inte tekniskt utbildad, istället finns mina styrkor i ledarskapet och organisationsutvecklingen. För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare.
 



**- Lisa Oldmar, Manager IT Customer and Accounts.** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I mer än 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Android Engineer, Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About Merchant Group**
 Merchant Group comprises Merchant Core, Growth, Operations Management, New Business sub-groups containing 25+ teams . These are cross-functional teams built with different skill sets, and we expect product engineers to collaborate with Data, Design and Product, ensuring we’re fulfilling our Merchants' needs.
   

  

 Merchant products make Wolt an integral part of our Merchants' daily lives. We build tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships. If that's something that gets you excited, don't hesitate to drop in your application.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As an
 **Android Engineer in Wolt’s Merchant Group** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of the merchant experience. We are building a brand-new, business-critical product that will empower hundreds of thousands of restaurants, supermarkets, and retailers to serve millions of customers worldwide - and you’ll have the opportunity to influence it from its very first line of code.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll design, implement, and refine the tools that merchants use every day - whether it’s managing menus and orders, tracking performance, or scaling their business. You’ll work closely with designers, analysts, product leads, and fellow engineers to ensure the app is intuitive, reliable, and scalable as our merchant base rapidly grows.
   

  

 This is a chance to
 **build from scratch** 
 with modern best practices, collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry. At Wolt, we value autonomy, ownership, and technical excellence. You’ll have the freedom to shape both
 **what** 
 we build and
 **how** 
 we build it - while receiving mentorship, support, and opportunities to grow every step of the way.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Working with senior developers in architecting and building key components of modern Android applications, leveraging both existing technology assets and new tools such as Jetpack Compose, Kotlin Coroutines, applying architecture patterns like MVI or MVVM, experience with Kotlin Multiplatform, and embracing modularization for scalability and maintainability.
* Influence architecture decisions and technology stack selection, and help steer overall product direction.
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to shape features and user experiences.
* Implement high-quality, scalable code while maintaining performance and security standards.
* Rapidly iterate and adapt to evolving requirements and ambiguous contexts.
* Continuously refine the app’s user experience to support and enhance merchants’ daily operations.
* Drive innovation and help to establish best practices for the team.


 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the role will be filled as soon as we find the right person -so don’t wait!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes a conversation with the Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team chat, and a final decision.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Staff Engineer - Authentication
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role & You**
 You’re a deeply curious person and that curiosity has led you deep into the world of authentication and identity. You care profoundly about how people prove who they are on the internet, how systems decide who gets access to what, and how we can make those decisions seamlessly and securely.
   

  

 Over the years, you’ve worked with a wide variety of authentication methods, identity frameworks, and security standards. You’ve seen the tradeoffs of different approaches firsthand and learned how to design systems that balance security, usability, and scalability. At your previous companies, people came to you when they wanted to understand how authentication
 *actually* 
 works under the hood.
   

  

 At Tandem, you’ll lead the effort to build secure, robust, and user-friendly authentication systems that power the next generation of healthcare products. You’ll define the technical direction, set standards, and design core identity infrastructure - enabling safe, seamless access for clinicians and patients across all European countries.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building authentication systems that people can trust and doing it at the scale and safety level healthcare demands we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

* Lead the design and development of our authentication and identity systems - from foundational protocols to user-facing access flows that are critical to clinician and patient trust.
* Define and implement robust authorization frameworks, ensuring users only access the data and functionality they are entitled to, while keeping the experience seamless.
* Evaluate and integrate industry standards and authentication technologies, understanding the tradeoffs to select the right approach for each use case.
* Build systems that scale securely, enabling safe and reliable identity management as our products grow to support healthcare organizations and their preferred Identity Providers across Europe..
* Serve as the go-to expert on authentication, helping others understand how identity systems work under the hood and driving best practices across the company.
* Set the technical direction for our identity and security efforts, mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of security, reliability, and technical excellence.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A proven track record of designing and implementing secure authentication and authorization systems in production environments.
* Deep experience with industry standards and identity frameworks (e.g. OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, or similar) and a clear understanding of their tradeoffs.
* The ability to build systems that remain secure, performant, and reliable at scale, including rolling out authentication stacks to large user bases.
* A passion for digital identity and a deep curiosity for how systems work under the hood, you want to understand, not just use, the technology.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate closely with engineering, product, and security stakeholders across the organization.
* A bias toward ownership, proactivity, and collaboration, you take responsibility for outcomes and raise the bar for everyone around you.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Strong experience building SSO integrations across diverse providers, and a clear vision for how to unify identity across multiple countries and healthcare partners.
* Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.
* Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers
* Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team
* First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: 5G Baseband Troubleshooter
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Grow with us at Ericsson! Join our Performance Engineering Unit in Kista, where we are responsible for systemizing, designing, implementing, and integrating software features to control the air interface in the 5G Radio Access Network (RAN). We are currently expanding our competence team focused on troubleshooting Baseband software issues. This team analyzes problems considering radio conditions, configuration feature combinations, and more.
   

  

 As part of this role, you will collaborate closely with colleagues across Ericsson and partner organizations, including customer-facing teams and internal test groups, to ensure quick, accurate, and professional resolution of Baseband software issues. Our troubleshooting team is also advancing on an automation journey, moving into data analytics and machine learning, which will be an important aspect of your work.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Troubleshoot reported Baseband software problems in depth to identify root causes and resolve issues.
* Collaborate with internal teams and partners globally to maintain system integrity and performance.
* Engage with customer-facing and test teams to ensure seamless communication and issue resolution.
* Support the transition towards automation, data analytics, and machine learning techniques in troubleshooting.
* The role is eligible for overtime based on project needs and workload.


**What you bring:**
* Extensive knowledge of 5G and LTE Radio Access Networks.
* Experience or strong interest in automation, data analytics, machine learning, and AI.
* Background in system design, testing, or programming related to Baseband software.
* Previous experience with C++ development, code review, debugging.
* Understanding of configuration management and troubleshooting tools is an advantage.
* Strong problem-solving skills, perseverance, and ability to work well under pressure.
* Technical degree (Bachelor's or higher) in a relevant field.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 769687
